intro: Aconitum tauricum var. eustachium, commonly known as the Caucasian monkshood, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It features striking blue to purple spurred flowers arranged in dense panicles, typical of the Aconitum genus. The plant has large, palmately divided leaves that are deeply cut, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. However, it is toxic due to the presence of potent alkaloids, requiring caution during handling and cultivation.
